thread.title: Yum Rises After Naming Corvex Founder Meister to its Board
thread.title_full: Yum Rises After Naming Corvex Founder Meister to its Board - Bloomberg Business

author: Bloomberg.com
title: Yum Rises After Naming Corvex Founder Meister to its Board
text:
Yum! Brands Inc. shares rose as much as 6 percent in late trading after naming Corvex Management founder Keith Meister to its board and saying that it is close to concluding a review of strategic options.
Meister’s appointment is effective on Friday, the Louisville, Kentucky-based company said Thursday in a statement. The company also said adjusted profit per share this year would range from little changed to a low-single-digit percentage gain.
Yum is trying to bring back diners to KFC and Pizza Hut restaurants in China after a food-supplier investigation and a slowing Chinese economy sent customers fleeing to competitors. Last week, the company reported another disappointing quarter for same-store sales out of China, which makes up about half of its revenue.
The shares climbed as high as $73.40 in after the close of regular trading in New York. Yum had slid 4.9 percent this year through Thursday’s close.
